intro: Chaenorhinum origanifolium var. microphyllum, commonly known as the small-leaved heartweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are smaller than the typical variety of Chaenorhinum origanifolium. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. The flowers, which range in color from pink to purple, bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
